00053 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00054 /// @class PhysWorld
00055 /// @brief This is the main entry point for the entire library.
00056 /// The physworld coordinates and integrates all the underlying subsystems,
00057 /// Currently Ogre3d is used for 3d Graphics, Bullet is used for physics, and
00058 /// SDL is used for user input and window management. Games will need a
00059 /// container for all the playing pieces. It makes sense to tie all of this
00060 /// functionality into one world object.
00061 ///////////////////////////////////////
00062 class PhysWorld
00063 {
00064         private:
00065                 //Physics Items
00066                 PhysVector3* GeographyLowerBounds;
00067                 PhysVector3* GeographyUpperbounds;
00068                 unsigned short int  MaxPhysicsProxies;
00069 
00070                 btAxisSweep3* BulletBroadphase;
00071                 btDefaultCollisionConfiguration* BulletCollisionConfiguration;
00072                 btCollisionDispatcher* BulletDispatcher;
00073                 btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver* BulletSolver;
00074                 btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld* BulletDynamicsWorld;
00075 
00076                 //SDL Objects
00077                 SDL_Surface *SDLscreen;
00078 
00079                 //Ogre objects
00080         Ogre::Root* OgreRoot;
00081         Ogre::RenderSystem* OgreRenderSystem;
00082         Ogre::RenderWindow* OgreGameWindow;
00083         Ogre::ResourceGroupManager* OgreResource;
00084                 Ogre::SceneManager* OgreSceneManager;
00085                 Ogre::Camera* OgreCamera;
00086                 Ogre::Viewport* OgreViewport;
00087 
00088                 //Players settings
00089                 Settings* PlayerSettings;
00090 
00091                 //Try to retrieve ogre settinss
00092                 void LoadOgreSettings();
00093 
00094                 //Manages the windows all the graphics will be drawn to
00095                 void CreateRenderWindow();
00096                 void DestroyRenderWindow();
00097 
00098                 //Used by the constructors
00099                 void Construct(PhysVector3* GeographyLowerBounds, PhysVector3* GeographyUpperbounds, unsigned short int MaxPhysicsProxies);
00100         void TestLogger();
00101         template <class T> void OneLogTest(T Data, string DataType,string Message1 = "Logging and Throwing a ", string Message2 = "Logging a ");
00102 
00103                 //SDL specific Items
00104                 //This function will get all the events from SDL and Sort them into one of two Queues
00105                 void PreProcessSDLEvents();
00106         queue<RawEvent*> SDL_WmEvents;
00107         queue<RawEvent*> SDL_UserInputEvents;
00108 
00109         /// This should be treated as an internal function, it is \b subject to change without warning \b and could be \b harmful \b to overall stability if used incorrectly
00110         friend void RenderPhysWorld(PhysWorld *TheWorld);
00111 
00112         public:
00113         /// @brief Descriptive constructor
00114         /// This constructor allows for an easier way to define the Boundaries of the int
00115         /// @param GeographyLowerBounds The lower limits for the size of the physics simulation
00116         /// @param GeographyUpperbounds The Upper limits for the size of the physics simulation
00117         /// @param MaxPhysicsProxies This is the amount of Adows (Also called Actors or Proxies) allowed in a physics simulation.
00118                 PhysWorld(PhysVector3* GeographyLowerBounds, PhysVector3* GeographyUpperbounds, unsigned short int MaxPhysicsProxies=1024);
